title: Structural Manipulation of Functional Metal Oxides by In-Situ TEM
content: Functional metal oxides are widely applied in the field of information, energy and environment. Structural evolution of the oxides acts as a fundamental process in their device operation. In this presentation, we will focus on the structural manipulation of functional metal oxides inside transmission electron microscope (TEM), where the real-time imaging of electrically and/or mechanically driven structural evolution at atomic scale was carried out by homemade in-situ TEM probe setup. In addition, the structural manipulation and in-situ observation were also realized by surface/interface confined nucleation and growth inside TEM.
